eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonReleased
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctions.description: Change a button state for a multitouch controller.

eventsFunctions.name: SetDeadZone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the dead zone of multitouch joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the dead zone radius of a joystick. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved).

eventsFunctions.name: IsDirectionPushed8Way
eventsFunctions.sentence: Joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

events.comment: Make sure the joystick has moved from center

eventsFunctions.description: the percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).

eventsFunctions.description: the force of multitouch contoller stick (from 0 to 1).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the angle of the joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchJoystick

events.comment: Move thumb back to center when not being pressed (acts like a spring on a real controller)

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0))
AngleBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0))
clamp(2 * DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.CenterX(), Object.CenterY(), TouchX(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0), TouchY(TouchId, Object.Layer(), 0)) / Object.Width(), 0, 1)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ThirdPersonCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the camera  to look at an object from a given distance.
description: Move the camera  to look at an object from a given distance with a rotation and an elevation angles.
- Isometric-like point of view ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-road-crosser))

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera to look at a position from a distance.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Look at a position from a distance (deprecated)
eventsFunctions.name: LookFromDistanceAtPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera of _PARAM6_ to look at _PARAM1_; _PARAM2_ from _PARAM3_ pixels with a rotation of _PARAM4_° and an elevation of _PARAM5_°

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera to look at an object from a distance.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Look at an object from a distance (deprecated)
eventsFunctions.name: LookFromDistanceAtObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera of _PARAM5_ to look at _PARAM1_ from _PARAM2_ pixels with a rotation of _PARAM3_° and an elevation of _PARAM4_°

eventsFunctions.fullName: Look at a position from a distance
eventsFunctions.name: LookFromDistanceAtPosition3D
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera of _PARAM7_ to look at _PARAM1_; _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ from _PARAM4_ pixels with a rotation of _PARAM5_° and an elevation of _PARAM6_°

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera to look at an object from a distance.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Look at an object from a distance
eventsFunctions.name: LookFromDistanceAtObject3D
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera of _PARAM6_ to look at _PARAM1_ from _PARAM3_ pixels with a rotation of _PARAM4_° and an elevation of _PARAM5_°

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly follow an object at a distance.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ThirdPersonCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * (1 - speed)^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln((1 - speed)))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

parameters: TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(CameraAngle(Object.Layer()), TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * RotationLogSpeed)
TargetedElevationAngle + ElevationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(90 - Scene3D::CameraRotationX(Object.Layer()), TargetedElevationAngle + ElevationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * ElevationLogSpeed)
